# Animation System Usage Guide This guide explains when to use Tailwind animations vs. the VueUse composable system. ## Quick Decision Tree ``` Need to animate something? │ ├─ Is it a hover effect or always-visible decoration? │ └─ ✅ Use Tailwind classes │ ├─ Does it need programmatic control (start/stop/reverse)? │ └─ ✅ Use useAnimateElement composable │ └─ Does it need lifecycle hooks or event coordination? └─ ✅ Use useAnimateElement composable ``` ## Shared Constants All timing constants are defined in `src/constants/animations.ts` and synced between both systems: ```typescript import { ANIMATION_DURATION, EASING } from '@/constants/animations' // Available durations (in milliseconds) ANIMATION_DURATION.INSTANT // 100ms - Quick feedback ANIMATION_DURATION.FAST // 200ms - Hover states, selections ANIMATION_DURATION.NORMAL // 300ms - Standard transitions ANIMATION_DURATION.SLOW // 500ms - Page transitions ANIMATION_DURATION.CELEBRATION // 2000ms - Success celebrations // Available easing functions EASING.EASE_OUT // Most common (decelerating) EASING.EASE_IN_OUT // Smooth start and end EASING.BOUNCE // Playful overshoot EASING.SMOOTH // Silky smooth EASING.SHARP // Quick and snappy EASING.ELASTIC // Extra bouncy ``` --- ## Option 1: Tailwind Utility Classes **When to use:** - ✅ Hover effects (`hover:scale-105`) - ✅ Static transitions (`transition-all duration-fast`) - ✅ Background decorations (floating orbs) - ✅ Always-visible animations (shimmer, pulse) **When NOT to use:** - ❌ Click-triggered animations - ❌ Sequences that need timing coordination - ❌ Animations with lifecycle events - ❌ Anything requiring start/stop control ### Examples #### Basic Hover Effect ```vue ``` #### Custom Timing ```vue

     3→import type { UseAnimateKeyframes, UseAnimateOptions } from '@vueuse/core'
     4→import { ANIMATION_DURATION, EASING, FILL_MODE } from '@/constants/animations'
     5→

   160→    ],

   166→  } as AnimationPreset,
   167→
   168→  slideOutLeft: {

   171→      { opacity: 0, transform: 'translateX(-100%)' }
   172→    ],
   173→    options: {
   174→      duration: ANIMATION_DURATION.FAST,
   175→      easing: EASING.SHARP,
   176→      fill: FILL_MODE.FORWARDS
   177→    }
   178→  } as AnimationPreset,
   179→} as const
   180→
   181→export function useAnimateElement(
   182→  target: MaybeComputedElementRef,
   183→  options: UseAnimateElementOptions = {}
   184→) {
   185→  const isMounted = useMounted()
   186→  const {
   187→    preset = 'fadeIn',
   188→    duration,
   189→    easing,
   190→    immediate = false,
   191→    stagger = 0,
   192→    onComplete
   193→  } = options
   194→
   195→  const presetConfig = animationPresets[preset]
   196→  const keyframes = presetConfig.keyframes
   197→
   198→  const baseOptions = typeof presetConfig.options === 'object' ? presetConfig.options : { duration: presetConfig.options }
   199→  const animationOptions = {
   200→    ...baseOptions,
   201→    ...(duration && { duration }),
   202→    ...(easing && { easing }),
   203→    // Avoid SSR window issues by not forcing a custom window here
   204→    immediate,
   205→    onReady: onComplete
   206→  } as UseAnimateOptions
   207→
   208→  const {
   209→    isSupported,
   210→    animate,
   211→    play,
   212→    pause,
   213→    reverse,
   214→    finish,
   215→    cancel,
   216→    pending,
   217→    playState,
   218→    currentTime,
   219→    playbackRate
   220→  } = useAnimate(target, keyframes, animationOptions)
   221→
   222→  const bounds = computed(() => {
   223→    const element = unref(target) as HTMLElement | null
   224→    return element?.getBoundingClientRect() || null
   225→  })
   226→
   227→  const animateIn = async (customKeyframes?: UseAnimateKeyframes, customOptions?: UseAnimateOptions) => {
   228→    if (!isMounted.value || !isSupported.value) return
   229→    if (customKeyframes && animate.value) {
   230→      cancel()
   231→      const element = unref(target) as HTMLElement | null
   232→      if (element) {
   233→        const newAnimation = element.animate(
   234→          customKeyframes as Keyframe[],
   235→          { ...animationOptions, ...customOptions }
   236→        )
   237→        if (onComplete) newAnimation.addEventListener('finish', onComplete)
   238→        return newAnimation
   239→      }
   240→    } else {
   241→      play()
   242→    }
   243→  }
   244→
   245→  const animateOut = async (outKeyframes?: UseAnimateKeyframes, outOptions?: UseAnimateOptions) => {
   246→    if (!isMounted.value || !isSupported.value) return
   247→    const defaultOutKeyframes = [
   248→      { opacity: 1, transform: 'scale(1)' },
   249→      { opacity: 0, transform: 'scale(0.8)' }
   250→    ]
   251→    const defaultOutOptions = {
   252→      duration: ANIMATION_DURATION.FAST,
   253→      easing: EASING.EASE_OUT,
   254→      fill: FILL_MODE.FORWARDS as FillMode
   255→    }
   256→    const element = unref(target) as HTMLElement | null
   257→    if (element) {
   258→      const animation = element.animate(
   259→        (outKeyframes || defaultOutKeyframes) as Keyframe[],
   260→        { ...defaultOutOptions, ...outOptions }
   261→      )
   262→      if (onComplete) animation.addEventListener('finish', onComplete)
   263→      return animation
   264→    }
   265→  }
   266→
   267→  const isAnimating = computed(() => pending.value || playState.value === 'running')
   268→
   269→  const animateStaggered = async (
   270→    elements: (HTMLElement | null)[],
   271→    staggerDelay: number = stagger || 50,
   272→    animationPreset: keyof typeof animationPresets = preset
   273→  ) => {
   274→    if (!isMounted.value) return []
   275→    const presetConfig = animationPresets[animationPreset]
   276→    const animations: Animation[] = []
   277→    elements.forEach((element, index) => {
   278→      if (!element) return
   279→      const baseOptions = typeof presetConfig.options === 'object' ? presetConfig.options : { duration: presetConfig.options }
   280→      const delayedOptions = { ...baseOptions, delay: index * staggerDelay }
   281→      const animation = element.animate(
   282→        presetConfig.keyframes as Keyframe[],
   283→        delayedOptions
   284→      )
   285→      animations.push(animation)
   286→    })
   287→    return animations
   288→  }
   289→
   290→  return {
   291→    animateIn,
   292→    animateOut,
   293→    animateStaggered,
   294→    isSupported,
   295→    animate,
   296→    play,
   297→    pause,
   298→    reverse,
   299→    finish,
   300→    cancel,
   301→    pending,
   302→    playState,
   303→    isAnimating,
   304→    currentTime,
   305→    playbackRate,
   306→    bounds,
   307→    presets: animationPresets
   308→  }
   309→}

   311→export function createAnimation(
   312→  target: MaybeComputedElementRef,
   313→  preset: keyof typeof animationPresets,
   314→  options?: Partial<UseAnimateElementOptions>
   315→) {
   316→  return useAnimateElement(target, { preset, ...options })
   317→}
   318→
   319→export function useStaggeredAnimation(
   320→  targets: MaybeComputedElementRef[],
   321→  preset: keyof typeof animationPresets = 'staggerFadeIn',
   322→  staggerDelay: number = 50
   323→) {
   324→  const animations = targets.map(target =>
   325→    useAnimateElement(target, { preset, immediate: false })
   326→  )
   327→  const playStaggered = async () => {
   328→    for (let i = 0; i < animations.length; i++) {
   329→      setTimeout(() => animations[i].play(), i * staggerDelay)
   330→    }
   331→  }
   332→  const cancelAll = () => animations.forEach(anim => anim.cancel())
   333→  return { animations, playStaggered, cancelAll }
